questions.question_text: Which function does an SNMP agent perform?

discussion.content:
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/ios-xml/ios/snmp/configuration/xe-16/snmp-xe-16-book/nm-snmp-cfg-snmp-support.html

A is correct

Selected Answer: A
A is correct
A is correct

This document discusses how to enable an SNMP agent on a Cisco device and how to control the sending of SNMP notifications from the agent. For information about using SNMP management systems, see the appropriate documentation for your network management system (NMS) application.

choices.C: It coordinates user authentication between a network device and a TACACS+ or RADIUS server
choices.B: It manages routing between Layer 3 devices in a network
choices.A: It sends information about MIB variables in response to requests from the NMS
choices.D: It requests information from remote network nodes about catastrophic system events

choices.A: The DHCP server assigns IP addresses without requiring the client to renew them.
choices.D: The DHCP server offers the ability to exclude specific IP addresses from a pool of IP addresses.
choices.B: The DHCP server leases client IP addresses dynamically.
choices.C: The DHCP client is able to request up to four DNS server addresses.
choices.E: The DHCP client maintains a pool of IP addresses it is able to assign.

comments.content: Best way to remember the answer... thank you

discussion.content:
Tricky question. Note DHCP is administered at the "Server" level. The word "client" in the other options was deliberate to mislead. DHCP server requires clients to renew IP except it is tied to MAC, hence option A is out. 
BD is correct.
E almost catch me

Selected Answer: BD
B & D are correct
why c is not correct?
if 'e' said, 'the dhcp server maintains a pool of IPs it is able to assign', that would also be correct

Selected Answer: BD
B & D are correct. E says CLIENT, Don't get tricked.

comments.content: If it’s DHCP server, it could be correct...

discussion.content: E why not

comments.content: Your right, in fact. Is important read the question with pacient and the options too. The answer is B and D. Is a easy question with a easy answer. But sometime we feels with so much confidence and believe we have this quiestions ready

discussion.content: BD is correct. Love how they throw in DHCP server and DHCP client. If you don't catch these minor misplacement of words, one can easily get this question wrong.

questions.question_text: What are two roles of the Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol (DHCP)? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
- ntp master {stratum-level}: NTP server mode—the device acts only as an NTP server,
and not as an NTP client. The device gets its time information from the internal clock on
the device.
- ntp server {address | hostname}: NTP client/server mode—the device acts as both client
and server. First, it acts as an NTP client, to synchronize time with a server. Once synchronized, the device can then act as an NTP server, to supply time to other NTP clients.
reference : Wendell Odom CCNA vol 2
Correct answer : B
mannaggia al netacad

Selected Answer: B
B is correct

questions.question_text: Which command must be entered when a device is configured as an NTP server?
What event has occurred if a router sends a notice level message to a syslog server?

comments.content: Every Awesome Cisco Engineer Will Need Ice Cream Daily :)

discussion.content:
0 Emergencies System shutting down due to missing fan tray
1 Alerts Temperature limit exceeded
2 Critical Memory allocation failures
3 Errors Interface Up/Down messages
4 Warnings Configuration file written to server, via SNMP request
5 Notifications Line protocol Up/Down
6 Information Access-list violation logging
7 Debugging Debug messages
ANSWER = B

When an interface goes down a log message is generated including the following "#LINEPROTO-5-UPDOWN". 
5 is the severity level. Severity 5 is classed as "notification"
Odum book 2 pages 176-177

Selected Answer: B
B is correct

Selected Answer: B
If a router sends a notice level message to a syslog server, it typically indicates that an interface line has changed status. the correct answer is B.

The two switch ought to model the spine-leaf network architecture to create a redundant network; that is, every host must have one connection to each switch, in case one of the switch goes inactive the other takes the relay.

discussion.content:
why in packet tracer a router accepts 192.168.1.1 /24 in one interface and 192.168.1.2 in another interface? 
And, the switches are connected toghether... so, if there was 2 different subnets this link were nonsese... I don't understand...

Selected Answer: C
to avoid ambiguity in the routing

Badly worded question. Not enough info is given. If these are L2 switches, then C is correct. That was probably the author's intention. However, if they are L3 switches, then C would be wrong, so D would be the answer. I think C is the answer they want.

comments.content: By the switch diagram, it is clear as L2 switch, if it is an L3 switch you would find the icon of multilayer switch.
If it was an L3 SW why would they show a router? I guess it was safe to assume.
also L3 switch has a different icon used by Cisco so

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
The link between the two switches creates a single broadcast domain. And a broadcast domain maps to a subnet.
Any interface on Router1 must be assigned to a subnet which is distinct from every other interface. But, in this case, the network design doesn’t comply with such requirement.

A. This design will function as intended.

Wrong answer.

B. Spanning-tree will need to be used.

Wrong answer.

C. The router will not accept the addressing scheme.

Correct answer.

D. The connection between switches should be a trunk.

Wrong answer.

E. The router interfaces must be encapsulated with the 802.1Q protocol.

Wrong answer.
C is right because Routers are meant to route through different networks
will not work. one vlan, no STP needed router stop broadcast. need router on stick and 2 vlan to work. C is correct.
Both Rs interfaces overlaping.

comments.content: I believe L2 switches with different IP subnet can't create the link and they don't know how to route.
The network needs to be designed properly before STP (PVST+ or other) can be used. According to the diagram, best answer that fits is C as router will not accept multiple IPs from the same subnet.
STP is needed to avoid packet loops on layer 2. The router does not forward layer 2 broadcast on routed interfaces, so there is no loop created, which would makes STP necessary.

discussion.content: Why not also B ? STP is needed as there are 2 SW no ?
ip address overlaps

choices.C: The router will not accept the addressing scheme.
choices.A: This design will function as intended.
choices.D: The connection between switches should be a trunk.
choices.E: The router interfaces must be encapsulated with the 802.1Q protocol.
choices.B: Spanning-tree will need to be used.
